content:
Greetings rustaceans!

I’m new to rust, but it seems like a great language. I’ve been teaching a broad range of subjects in computer science at Cornell for the past 7 years - functional programming, oop, discrete math, operating systems, data structures and algorithms, and I have a strong interest in languages and language design. Recently I’ve been wanting to get back into building real systems, which is part of why I’ve started learning rust.

I’m interested in the trait system - my favorite language learning project (exact arithmetic with irrational numbers) quickly made me really want implied trait bounds, which in turn led me to the project to integrate chalk into rustc. I would be interested in learning more about that and trying out any prototypes that exist; if I could be helpful, I might have some time to pitch in, though I’m new to large OSS projects and rust programming.

Incidentally, I’m looking for a job. If you think I might be a good candidate for you, please email me at mdgeorge@cs.cornell.edu.

Cheers!
